sign-up_logo-upload: or click here to upload an image
sign-up_step2-text1:
Please build your initial database using the template below. Please, make sure you match all the necessary fields and follow the instructions.

The mandatory fields are:

 •ID - the ID number must be specified in each row in order for the uploading process to be completed

 •First and Last Name

 •Gender and Birthdate – required in order to build the demography visualization and filter the databased according to demography

 •Status – this is required for visualization of statuses. During elections the status will refer to support or oppose. In times when elections are not taking place the status will refer to party member or not party member. Pay attention that Status is a drop-down menu. the list of statuses for the dropdown menu will be taken from your file. Only statuses that you have in your initial file will be available.

 •City, Street and Building - this information is required in order to identify the records by and create the affiliation by household

 •Joining Date – required in order to create statistics of new party members

 •Phone, Mobile Phone and Email - this information is required for the distribution system

Please note that all fields that are not matched from the dropdown menu, will be available for use in the system at any time.

You can configure name and datatypes under the settings tab at any point.

There are 3 fields that are mandatory for the system but you can skip them. If you choose to skip them the system will create those fields anyway and keep them blank.

Those fields are – cancelation date, apartment number, and referral.

If you choose to put a referral you should enter an ID number only (no name!)

Please use the template we created to make sure you enter the necessary data in the appropriate format.
sign-up_template-upload: Or click here to upload a template
sign-up_step3-keywords: Please insert the keywords you wish STOI'c CMS will monitor
stats_post-collecting: No results found - consider broadening your search, trying different keywords, or resetting filters
stats_post-hint1: The graph provides an analysis of total users’ engagement (each activity receives a different value) with regard to specific post performance and calculates a score for audience growth (increase or decrease) as a result of the online activities. The score is calculated by assets in a given time frame.
stats_post-hint2: You can click on each dot to see the specific post performance and the data analysis about it.
stats_post-hint3: To set up, go to Settings (Follow the Arrow)
stats_preview-collecting: No results found - consider broadening your search, trying different keywords, or resetting filters
stats_map-hint1: The map includes pins and circles. The pins represent past data. The circles represent the activity potential growth according to our unique models.
stats_map-hint2:
The radius of the circle indicates the level of growth potential,
The color indicates if the geographical polygon is in favor or against the organization activities (blue is in favor red is against).
stats_keywords-hint:
The system monitors the key words you entered in order to identify trends that are of interest to the voters.

The bigger the word the more it is in use. 

Red means the word was used in a negative connotation. 

Blue means the word was used in a positive connotation.

Below you can see the distribution of positive and negative content
stats_status-hint: The status is the foundation of the system, it is a key component in every process of the system. By using the status option you can direct the whole operation of the system.
sm-score_hint-text: The total score of all online social media interactions in the time frame that was set for the system compared to the previous time frame
total-reach_hint-text: Total number of times a specific item of content appeared on a users’ feed
unique-reach_hint-text: The number of different people that viewed a specific content
engagement-rate_hint-text: The total number of all interactions with the digital assets that the system monitors in the particular time frame that was set by the user.
offline-score_hint-text: The percentage of support change based on the data that was uploaded to the system by the user. The score number reflects whether support has gone up or down based on the updated data.

raw-data_update-text2: 2. Add columns: paste an ID list to the text box
raw-data_update-text3: 3. Update search query: first go to filters and apply a search query, then go to add field, choose the field you would like to update and the value and click apply

ranking_ai_setting_tip_batch_content: - how many pictures you’d like to get.
ranking_ai_setting_tip_seed_content: - The seed value is a starting point for generating values. Using seed you can recreate images that other generated. Any number.
ranking_ai_setting_tip_steps_content: - The number of iterations that the Stable Diffusion model runs to transform the initial noise into a recognizable image, 25 steps are a good starting point
ranking_ai_setting_tip_cfg_content: - indicates how closely you'd like your artwork generator to follow the input text or phrases you provide, enabling users to balance image fidelity and creativity. We recommend keeping the CFG value between 7 and 10

google_ads-audience_campaign-h1: The delivery method that determines the rate at which the campaign budget is spent. Defaults to STANDARD if unspecified in a create operation.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h4: Immutable. The primary serving target for ads within the campaign. The targeting options can be refined in network_settings. This field is required and should not be empty when creating new campaigns. Can be set only when creating campaigns. After the campaign is created, the field can not be changed.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h5: The delivery method that determines the rate at which the campaign budget is spent. Defaults to STANDARD if unspecified in a create operation.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h10: The match type of the keyword.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h11: The text of the keyword (at most 80 characters and 10 words).
google_ads-audience_campaign-h14: list of string of variety ad text. MINIMUM 4 for SEARCH. 1 for DISPLAY.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h15: list of string of variety ad text. MINIMUM 4. 1 for DISPLAY
google_ads-audience_campaign-h16: list of string of variety ad text. MINIMUM 4. 1 for DISPLAY
google_ads-audience_campaign-h17: The language code specifying the language of the domain, forexample, "en".
google_ads-audience_campaign-h18: First part of text that can be appended to the URL in the ad.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h19: Second part of text that can be appended to the URL in the ad. This field can only be set when path1 is also set.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h20: The target cost-per-action (CPA) option. This is the average amount that you would like to spend per conversion action specified in micro units of the bidding strategy's currency. If set, the bid strategy will get as many conversions as possible at or below the target cost-per-action. If the target CPA is not set, the bid strategy will aim to achieve the lowest possible CPA given the budget.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h24: list of string of variety ad text. MINIMUM 4 for SEARCH. 1 for DISPLAY.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h25: list of string of variety ad text. MINIMUM 4. 1 for DISPLAY
google_ads-audience_campaign-h26: call to action text for DISPLAY
google_ads-audience_campaign-h27: Prefix before price. For example, 'as low as'.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h28: Promotion text used for dynamic formats of responsive ads. For example 'Free two-day shipping'.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h29: Valid image types are GIF, JPEG, and PNG. The minimum size is 600x314 and the aspect ratio must be 1.91:1 (+-1%). One marketingImage is required.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h30: Valid image types are GIF, JPEG, and PNG. The minimum size is 300x300 the aspect ratio must be 1:1 (+-1%). One squareMarketingImage is required.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h31: The target cost-per-action (CPA) option. This is the average amount that you would like to spend per conversion action specified in micro units of the bidding strategy's currency. If set, the bid strategy will get as many conversions as possible at or below the target cost-per-action. If the target CPA is not set, the bid strategy will aim to achieve the lowest possible CPA given the budget.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h32: Immutable. A string that uniquely identifies a mobile application.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h33: Immutable. The application store that distributes this specific app.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h34: Represents the goal which the bidding strategy of this app campaign should optimize towards.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h35: Immutable. Optional refinement to advertising_channel_type. Must be a valid sub-type of the parent channel type. Can be set only when creating campaigns. After campaign is created, the field can not be changed.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h36: Valid image types are GIF, JPEG, and PNG. The minimum size is 600x314 and the aspect ratio must be 1.91:1 (+-1%). One marketingImage is required.
google_ads-audience_campaign-h37: Valid image types are GIF, JPEG, and PNG. The minimum size is 300x300 the aspect ratio must be 1:1 (+-1%). One squareMarketingImage is required.
google_ads-criteria_campaign-h2: List of locations`s names for targeting
google_ads-create_campaign-h3: The delivery method that determines the rate at which the campaign budget is spent. Defaults to STANDARD if unspecified in a create operation.
google_ads-create_campaign-h4: Immutable. The primary serving target for ads within the campaign. The targeting options can be refined in network_settings. This field is required and should not be empty when creating new campaigns. Can be set only when creating campaigns. After the campaign is created, the field can not be changed.
google_ads-create_campaign-h6: The Internet domain name that this setting represents, for example, "google.com" or "www.google.com".
google_ads-create_campaign-h7: The language code specifying the language of the domain, for example, "en".
google_ads-create_campaign-h8: The target cost-per-action (CPA) option. This is the average amount that you would like to spend per conversion action specified in micro units of the bidding strategy's currency. If set, the bid strategy will get as many conversions as possible at or below the target cost-per-action. If the target CPA is not set, the bid strategy will aim to achieve the lowest possible CPA given the budget.
google_ads-create_campaign-h9: The target cost-per-action (CPA) option. This is the average amount that you would like to spend per conversion action specified in micro units of the bidding strategy's currency. If set, the bid strategy will get as many conversions as possible at or below the target cost-per-action. If the target CPA is not set, the bid strategy will aim to achieve the lowest possible CPA given the budget.

google_ads-create_campaign-h12: Represents the goal which the bidding strategy of this app campaign should optimize towards.

google_ads-criteria_group-h8: The text of the keyword (at most 80 characters and 10 words).

settings_fields-hint1:
We recommend you organize the fields to more convenient use.

Mandatory fields cannot be delated

Name: choose the name of the filed that will be displayed in the table in the data management screen

Show in table – select this option to show the field in the data table in the data management tab (election day and bingo fields must show in the table for the election day dashboard to work)

Create filter – select this option to show the field in the filter options in the data management tab
settings_fields-hint2:
Create/update window – select this option to add this field to an individual record in the data base table in the data management screen

Dropdown – select this option to create a dropdown menu instead of open text

Multiple answers - select this option if you want to be able to choose more than one answer per field.

Required - select this option to make the field required when adding a new record

Manual input - select this option to add information manually to this field in the filter options in the data management tab

Create a report - select this option to create and download reports for this field

You can create a new field by scrolling down and click the option Create new field.
settings_fields-numeric_warn: You can only use numerical characters in this field. The characters that you entered are not numerical, please try again.
settings_status-hint: You must define at least one very positive status and one very negative status. Please assign a color to each status. In the text boxes below please enter the words you want the system to include and the words you would like the system to exclude from text messages. To add a new status please scroll down and klick on Add new status.
